Hokie Spaces

  • Henderson Hall

Henderson Hall

Henderson Hall is a building located at the center of campus
and Blacksburg, yet it is fairly unknown despite it's many
resources, few know about the building.

Henderson Hall is located past the Squires student center, towards Main Street. It's official address is "195 Alumni Mall, Blacksburg, VA 24061." Compared to other buildings on campus, Henderson Hall is undervalued and underrated despite its plethora of resources. The primary is for off campus students, it is located on the main drive through campus Alumni Mall, allowing for easy parking, either after hours or at a paid meter. Inside, there is a costume shop, a computer lab, study spaces, practice room, etc.. Henderson Hall offers many resources that students can use. Henderson Hall, unlike most buildings on campus has specific hours. It is open from 7am to 7:30 pm. Outside of these hours, it is possible to access Henderson Hall through swipe access; however, swipe access is only granted to Art and Music Majors.

Site Inspection

Several students researched the Henderson Hall and searched for all of the potential resources there. They discovered many. Henderson Hall has a plethora or different tools; most of the tools are tailored toward Music and Art students, however many of these tools can be accessed by any students. The 3rd floor contains pianos, including a suprisingly nice grand piano, and practice rooms that are open to everyone.

User Survey

User Interviews

When users were interviewed about this location there were many different opinions about the space. Students who have a specific reason to be there tend to like the resorces that Henderson provides. Such as, students within the art and theatre major tend to like the musical instruments that are provided as well as the open space to proactice. Students who need to visit thier professor's office hours tend to like the space as it is near a bus stop, parking lot and Squires Student center. However, an overwhelming consensus of students is that the rooms are elimited in which to study, however that being said it is a very quiet place to practice if need be or hold a small review session.
